body_html:
Thanks, unfortunately it doesn't seem to work with seed=0 either, tested on the latest nightly from Build #457 (Apr 14, 2017 1:03:00 AM) (nightly whl binary downloaded from the repository, for Mac, CPU-only version, Python 2.)

I get the following output for the above code when using seed 0 in both cases:

[ 1.53692079]
[ 1.01875198]

Is there a reason why it should only be deterministic for that specific seed?
Edit: It appears commit e9786df only fixed a specific bug for tf.set_random_seed(0) so it seems unrelated since I've tried various seeds and always get different results for a and b.

body:
Thanks, unfortunately it doesn't seem to work with seed=0 either, tested on the latest nightly from `Build #457 (Apr 14, 2017 1:03:00 AM)` (nightly whl binary downloaded from the repository, for Mac, CPU-only version, Python 2.)

I get the following output for the above code when using seed 0 in both cases:
```
[ 1.53692079]
[ 1.01875198]
```

Is there a reason why it should only be deterministic for that specific seed?
Edit: It appears commit e9786df5e89f0345b2eb32d688c7be31c5259ba0 only fixed a specific bug for `tf.set_random_seed(0)` so it seems unrelated since I've tried various seeds and always get different results for a and b.
